Coconut Cold Brew Coffee Recipe | Bon Appétit

If you’re in the habit of buying an iced coffee from a shop every day, this economical homemade version will save you time—and reduce your plastic use.IngredientsMakes 3 cups16oz. coffee beans (about 4 cups), coarsely ground1½cups toasted unsweetened shredded coconut3cups milk (cow’s, oat, or nut) or water2Tbsp. (or more) pure maple syrupPreparationStep 1Place coffee and coconut in large bowl, jar, or pot. Slowly pour in 8 cups cool water and stir very gently until grounds are just moistened. Cover and chill 24 hours.Step 2Strain coffee grounds through a fine-mesh sieve into a large measuring glass or bowl. Discard grinds. Line sieve with a coffee filter and add as much coffee as will fit. Strain gradually into a 1-qt. airtight container or jar, adding more coffee as space is available until all the coffee has been added. Allow grounds to sit in strainer and continue to drip 20 minutes.Step 3To serve, pour ½ cup coffee into an ice-filled glass; add ½ cup milk and 1 tsp. maple syrup and stir to combine.Step 4Do Ahead: Cold brew (without milk and maple syrup) can be made 2 weeks ahead. Keep chilled.How would you rate Coconut Cold Brew Coffee?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (1)Back to TopTriangleI wouldn’t say the cold brew tasted spectacularly coconut-y, but it did give my typical cold brew a different (and better, imo) flavor. Toasting the coconut takes a little time, so I only do this when a have time to spare, but it’s fun and delicious to add into the mix.
